metadata.title: CVE-2019-19051 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A memory leak in the i2400m_op_rfkill_sw_toggle() function indrivers/net/wimax/i2400m/op-rfkill.c in the Linux kernel before 5.3.11allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption), akaCID-6f3ef5c25cc7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19051` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-174-generic - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-174-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-174-lowlatency - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-174-generic - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-174-lowlatency - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1062-aws - 4.4.0-1062.66
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1074-azure - 4.15.0-1074.79~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1062.66').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1074.79~14.04.1').
